entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 4:56PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT APACHE AND NAVAJO COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM MST... At 455 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Hibbard to 8 miles southwest of Rainbow Forest Lodge. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 17 at 9:59AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Iowa DNR has issued an Air Quality Alert for fine particulate pollution, which is in effect for portions of west central and southwest Iowa through midnight tonight... Fine particulate levels near or above EPA health standards are expected to remain elevated today as smoke from wildfires in Canada settles into the area.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 17 at 2:31PM PDT until September 18 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS TODAY AND MONDAY... .A pair of dry cold fronts will sweep through the region today and Monday, making for breezy conditions during the afternoon and evening hours each day. Winds are expected to be at their strongest on Monday, with RHs remaining at critical levels despite cooler conditions prevailing behind today`s front.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 2:28PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG AND PATCHY FROST EXPECTED TONIGHT... Areas of ground fog may become locally dense fog across central, north- central, and far northeast Wisconsin late tonight. Rapid reductions of visibilities below one quarter mile are possible in the fog, which could make the Monday morning commute hazardous at times. Where fog develops, visibilities are expected
entry.cap:areaDesc: Florence; Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Oneida; Vilas
